alert.note: Alert for Hoke; Montgomery; Moore; Richmond (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 29 at 3:50PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Hoke, Montgomery, Moore and Richmond. * WHEN...Until 515 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 349 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to nearly stationary showers and thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southern Pines, Troy, Carthage, Badin Lake, Pinehurst, Aberdeen, Biscoe, Hoffman, Whispering Pines, Pinebluff, Mount Gilead, Robbins, Ellerbe, Foxfire, Star, Candor, Taylortown, Vass, Norman and Eagle Springs.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
